00022 using System;
00023 using MathNet.Numerics.RandomSources;
00024 using MathNet.Numerics.Properties;
00025 
00026 namespace MathNet.Numerics.Distributions
00027 {
00028     // TODO: NUnit test for ZipfGenerator
00029     /* Note: ZipfGenerator seems to returns value that are really
00030      * big, must check the validity of the formula in use. */
00031 
00032     // TODO: Integrate into iridium's distribution pattern/approach
00033     // (e.g. includes providing pmf & cdf, inheriting from superclass etc.)
00034 
00046     public sealed class ZipfDistribution
00047     {
00048         RandomSource random;
00049 
00050         private double skew;
00051 
00055         public ZipfDistribution()
00056         {
00057             this.skew = 2d;
00058             random = new SystemRandomSource();
00059         }
00060 
00065         public ZipfDistribution(RandomSource random)
00066         {
00067             this.skew = 2d;
00068             this.random = random;
00069         }
00070 
00074         public ZipfDistribution(double skew)
00075         {
00076             if(skew <= 1d)
00077             {
00078                 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException("skew", skew, string.Format(Resources.ArgumentOutOfRangeGreater, "skew", "1.0"));
00079             }
00080 
00081             this.skew = skew;
00082             random = new SystemRandomSource();
00083         }
00084 
00088         public ZipfDistribution(double skew, int seed)
00089         {
00090             if(skew <= 1d)
00091             {
00092                 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException("skew", skew, string.Format(Resources.ArgumentOutOfRangeGreater, "skew", "1.0"));
00093             }
00094 
00095             this.skew = skew;
00096             random = new SystemRandomSource(seed);
00097         }
00098 
00102         public double Skew
00103         {
00104             get
00105             {
00106                 return skew;
00107             }
00108 
00109             set
00110             {
00111                 if(value <= 1d)
00112                 {
00113                     throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException("value", value, string.Format(Resources.ArgumentOutOfRangeGreater, "skew", "1.0"));
00114                 }
00115 
00116                 skew = value;
00117             }
00118         }
00119 
00123         public double Next()
00124         {
00125             /* A transformation method (similar to the exponential
00126              * generator) is used here to generate a zipfian deviate. */
00127 
00128             double p = random.NextDouble();
00129             return Math.Pow(1d - p, 1d / (1d - skew));
00130         }
00131     }
00132 }
